page.title: 02Edinburgh Childrens' Games
page.content: We thought about the games we played under 2 headings-Indoor & Outdoor games. {Indoor Games-}these included board games, activity and paper and pencil games. We did a survey of board games and found that the games most families owned were Scrabble, Monopoly and Cluedo. Our top ten board games were headed by Scrabble. Games were said to be "good" if they were easy to play, exciting and not too long, if the rules were easily understood and if you won things along the way. Computer games were also becoming popular. {Outdoor Games-}favourites included hopscotch(called peevers in Scotland), skipping, football, chasey or tig, hide and seek, rounders and other ball games. There were many choosing rhymes to elect players with "Eeny, Meeny, Miney, Mo" being most popular.
